Day 1.title: Martyrdom Day of Shahid Udham Singh

facts.1: Udham Singh was an Indian revolutionary best known for assassinating Michael O'Dwyer in March 1940, as an avengement of the Jallianwala Bagh Massacre.
facts.2: He is regarded as a Shaheed or martyr by the Indian people, and Martyrdom Day is observed in his remembrance.
facts.3: His actions inspired further independence movements and he remains a significant figure in Indian history.

facts.1: Black Tot Day refers to the last day the British Royal Navy issued sailors with a daily rum ration, known as the 'tot'.
facts.2: The tradition ended on 31 July 1970, a day that is still commemorated by naval rum enthusiasts.
facts.3: It marks the end of a 300-year-old Royal Navy tradition and is sometimes observed by drinking a tot of rum.

facts.1: Ka Hae Hawaiʻi Day, also known as Hawaiian Flag Day, commemorates the day Hawaii's flag was officially adopted in 1843.
facts.2: It was first officially celebrated in 1990 and pays tribute to the history of the Hawaiian Kingdom.
facts.3: The holiday is marked with cultural displays, parades, and educational events celebrating Hawaiian heritage and the flag's symbolism.
